Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies

Class OffensiveStrategy

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.CPUStrategy
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.cpustrategies.OffensiveStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayStrategy
public class OffensiveStrategy extends CPUStrategy
This strategy will be chosen by the CPUPlayer if they are in good position (score close to 5, well ranked, or has a lot of cards).

It will be likely to choose to play as a Villager. It can even sometimes accept to reveal their identity if it is in their interest.

It will also be more likely to play risked cards than other strategies, and to choose to play Hunt! effect.

Chooses cards based mostly on their Hunt! effect and values cards tagged as offensive.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • OffensiveStrategy

      public OffensiveStrategy()
      This strategy will consider that a player is low on cards under a lower thresold than other strategies. Thus, it will spend cards easier.

  • Method Details

    • selectIdentity

      public Identity selectIdentity()

      Chooses an identity.

      VILLAGER is more suited for a player with an aggressive playstyle, while WITCH corresponds better to a player with a defensive or careful playstyle

      This strategy will be very likely to make a player choose to play as a VILLAGER, since a lot of Hunt! effects require the player to be a villager, and since it allows it to keep playing even if revealed and/or out of cards.

      There is still a little chance for it to choose to play as a WITCH.

      Returns:
      Either VILLAGER or WITCH.
      See Also:
      • Identity
      • CPUPlayer::chooseIdentity()

    • selectTurnAction

      public TurnAction selectTurnAction(Identity identity, RumourCardsPile myHand, boolean canHunt)

      Chooses an action to perform on the player's turn, based on the current situation.

      When playing as a witch, a CPU Player will logically be more likely to choose to accuse another player, and even more when the situation becomes critical.

      There is always a chance of choosing to play a play a Hunt! effect, excepted when the player only has risked Hunt! effects.

      This strategy will be more likely to choose to play a Hunt! effect than others.

      If the calling player is VILLAGER, the more cards they have, the more likely it is to choose to hunt.

      Otherwise, if they are a WITCH, they will hunt only if they have cards with valuable Hunt! effects, that are not risked, or if they still have a lot of cards.

      Generally speaking, a WITCH using this strategy will be more likely to choose to accuse. in order to keep their cards.

      Specified by:
      selectTurnAction in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectTurnAction in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      identity - The calling cpu-controlled player's identity.
      myHand - The calling cpu-controlled player's hand.
      canHunt - A boolean indicating whether the calling cpu-controlled player can or can't hunt.
      Returns:
      Either ACCUSE or HUNT.
      See Also:
      • TurnAction
      • CPUPlayer::chooseTurnAction()

    • selectPlayerToAccuse

      public Player selectPlayerToAccuse(List<Player> accusablePlayersList)

      Selects a player to accuse within a list.

      Players using this strategy will be likely to focus the accusable players with the lowest number of revealed cards.
      Parameters:
      accusablePlayersList - The list within which a player must be accused
      Returns:
      The chosen target
      See Also:
      • Player.accuse(Player)

    • selectWitchCard

      public RumourCard selectWitchCard(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Selects a Rumour card valued for its Witch? effect within a given pile of Rumour cards. This strategy will be likely to choose to play the Witch? effect of cards with the lowest Hunt! effect values. Uses witch effects only as a defense against accusation, avoids wasting cards with powerful Hunt! effects.
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the choice can be made.
      Returns:
      A Rumour card from the player's hand chosen for its Witch? effect in particular.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer.selectWitchCard()
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap

    • selectNextPlayer

      public Player selectNextPlayer(List<Player> list)

      Selects a player to take the next turn.

      Most strategies will avoid giving the next turn to the leading players.

      Players using this strategy will be likely to choose the players with the lowest number of revealed cards to take the next turn, unless they only have exactly one (it is then better to let someone else play, hoping this player will get accused).
      Parameters:
      list - A list of players within which the next player has to be selected.
      Returns:
      The chosen player to take the next turn.
      See Also:
      • CPUPlayer::chooseNextPlayer()

    • selectBestCard

      public RumourCard selectBestCard(RumourCardsPile rcp, boolean seeUnrevealedCards)
      Selects the best card according to the strategy within a given pile of Rumour cards. Useful when picking a new card or taking back a revealed card from your own hand. Default definition for what is the "best" card within a pile. Priority is given to Hunt! effects values, as long as the player is not in a bad position. If there unrevealed cards cannot be seen, they have equal chances to be chosen than the best revealed cards.
      Specified by:
      selectBestCard in interface PlayStrategy
      Overrides:
      selectBestCard in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      rcp - The pile of Rumour cards within which the best card has to be selected.
      seeUnrevealedCards - If this boolean is true, the strategy will be able to access the properties of unrevealed cards as well.
      Returns:
      A random card in a list made of the cards with the best overall value + the unrevealed cards if they can't be seen
      See Also:
      • isConfident(RumourCardsPile)

    • isConfident

      private boolean isConfident(RumourCardsPile rcp)
      Even with this agressive strategy, there are situations where it is preferable to stay careful. This private method is used to avoid running like a bull when the situation requires caution
      Parameters:
      rcp - The calling player's hand
      Returns:
      false if the game is considered tight (only a few unrevealed players left) or if the player is short on cards, true otherwise.

    • findsValuable

      protected boolean findsValuable(RumourCard rc, Identity myIdentity, RumourCardsPile myHand)

      Asserts whether a Rumour card should be considered valuable or not, depending on the situation and of the card's values and special benefits.

      For example, when playing as a witch, even if a card's Witch? effect value is not juged interesting, it can be valuable if it is a protective card.

      As a VILLAGER, also finds valuable cards with offensive effects and positive both Witch and Hunt values.
      Overrides:
      findsValuable in class CPUStrategy
      Parameters:
      rc - The Rumour card the value of which is being discussed.
      myIdentity - The identity of the player using this strategy.
      myHand - The hand of the player using this strategy.
      Returns:
      true if the card is found valuable by this strategy, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • CardValue
      • CardValueMap
